title: Article
description: The Articles API is a central place to gather all information and take actions on your articles. Articles can live within collections and sections, or alternatively they can stand alone.

id.description: The unique identifier for the article which is given by Intercom.

workspace_id.description: The id of the workspace which the article belongs to.

title.description: The title of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the title of the default language's content.
title.example: Default language title

description.description: The description of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the description of the default language's content.
description.example: Default language description

body.description: The body of the article in HTML. For multilingual articles, this will be the body of the default language's content.
body.example: Default language body in html

author_id.description: The id of the author of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the id of the author of the default language's content. Must be a teammate on the help center's workspace.

state.description: Whether the article is `published` or is a `draft`. For multilingual articles, this will be the state of the default language's content.

created_at.description: The time when the article was created. For multilingual articles, this will be the timestamp of creation of the default language's content.

updated_at.description: The time when the article was last updated. For multilingual articles, this will be the timestamp of last update of the default language's content.

url.description: The URL of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the URL of the default language's content.

parent_id.description: The id of the article's parent collection or section. An article without this field stands alone.

parent_type.description: The type of parent, which can either be a `collection` or `section`.

default_locale.description: The default locale of the help center. This field is only returned for multilingual help centers.

translated_content.title: Article Translated Content
translated_content.description: The Translated Content of an Article. The keys are the locale codes and the values are the translated content of the article.

ar.description: The content of the article in Arabic
ar.title: Article Content

title.example: How to create a new article

description.example: This article will show you how to create a new article.

body.example: This is the body of the article.

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the article.

state.description: Whether the article is `published` or is a `draft` .

created_at.description: The time when the article was created.

updated_at.description: The time when the article was last updated.

views.description: The number of total views the article has received.

conversions.description: The number of conversations started from the article.

reactions.description: The number of total reactions the article has received.

happy_reaction_precentage.description: The percentage of happy reactions the article has received against other types of reaction.

netural_reaction_precentage.description: The percentage of neutral reactions the article has received against other types of reaction.

sad_reaction_precentage.description: The percentage of sad reactions the article has received against other types of reaction.
